revision.text:
{{Infobox military person |name=Iván Roberto Duque Gaviria |birth_date= |image= |caption= |nickname=Ernesto Báez |birth_place=[[Aguadas, Caldas|Aguadas]], [[Caldas Department|Caldas]]
{{COL}} |death_place= |allegiance=[[United Self-Defense Forces of Colombia]] (AUC)
[[paramilitarism in Colombia|Paramilitarism]]
[[Narcotrafficking in Colombia|Narcotrafficking]] |branch= |serviceyears= |rank= Bloc commander |unit= [[Bolivar Central Bloc]] |commands= |battles= |awards= |relations= |laterwork= }} '''Iván Roberto Duque Gaviria''' aka '''Ernesto Báez''' (born May 9, 1955 in [[Aguadas, Caldas|Aguadas]], [[Caldas Department|Caldas]]) is a [[Colombia]]n [[paramilitarism in Colombia|paramilitary]] leader former member of the demobilized [[United Self-Defense Forces of Colombia]] (AUC). Duque-Gaviria graduated as a lawyer from the ''[[Universidad de Caldas]]''. Duque Gaviria began his career as a member of the [[Colombian Liberal Party]], he was democratically elected as Mayor of the municipality of [[La Merced, Caldas|La Merced]] and later worked for the ''[[Empresas Públicas de Manizales]]''. In 1982 founded the ''Asociación Campesina de Ganaderos y Agricultores del Magdalena Medio'', ACDEGAM (Ranchers and Farmers of the Middle Magdalena Peasant Association) in [[Puerto Boyaca]] presumably as a facade for the creation of paramilitary groups for the troubled region. Duque Gaviria became an adviser to this organization and was later arrested in connection to paramilitary organizations accused by the [[Attorney General of Colombia]]. He was arrested and imprisoned at [[La Modelo|La Modelo Maximum Security Prison]] under assassination and conformation of illegal paramilitary groups charges. ==AUC commander== After being released from jail Duque met with [[Peasant Self-Defense Forces of Córdoba and Urabá]], [[Carlos Castaño Gil|Carlos Castaño]] who was at the moment developing the [[United Self-Defense Forces of Colombia]] (AUC) Duque joined him and went clandestine under the alias "Ernesto Baez". Castaño and Baez decided to create a major group for the [[Middle Magdalena Region]] called "[[Bolivar Central Bloc]] (''Bloque Central Bolívar'', BCB) with Baez as commander. After sometime of cordiality between Castaño and Baez their views towards each other resented to the point of becoming enemies. Baez disliked how Castaño became the de facto speaker of the organization and also had differences with another paramilitary with affinities with Castaño with the alias of "''[[Doble Cero]]''" commander of the [[Metro Bloc]] after the killing of two members of the BCB in 2002 in an internal cleansing. This episode led to Baez' decision to work closely with [[Diego Murillo Bejarano]] (aka "Adolfo Paz" aka "Don Berna") and Castano's brother [[Vicente Castaño]]. In 2004 Vicente ordered the assassination of his own brother Carlos and "Doble Cero". During the [[AUC demobilization]] Baez was granted immunity and political status by the [[government of Colombia]] as member of the AUC and later surrendered under the [[Law of Justice and Peace of Colombia]]. He is currently serving time in a Colombian prison for paramilitarism. ==See also== *[[United Self-Defense Forces of Colombia]] ==External links== *[http://www.prensarural.org/vargas20040804.htm El verdadero rostro de Ernesto Baez] {{DEFAULTSORT:Baez, Ernesto}} [[Category:1955 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Caldas Department]] [[Category:Colombian Liberal Party politicians]] [[Category:Members of the United Self-Defense Forces of Colombia]] [[Category:Warlords]] [[Category:Colombian drug traffickers]] [[Category:Colombian prisoners and detainees]] [[Category:Prisoners and detainees of Colombia]] [[Category:Colombian assassins]]
